column1: Hoo! We're late, late, late! We have twenty, maximum, twenty-two minutes, for your royal fitting! And then it's move, move, move to your speech at the Historical Society! After that we have to rush, and I mean, rush, to the Horticultural Society Tea! Oh, and then there's your math lessons, your geography lessons, your science lessons...
column2: All my life I've always wanted to have one day just for me. Nothing to do and for once nowhere I need to be. With no lessons, lords, or lunches, or 'to do' list in the way. No one to say when to eat or read or leave or stay. That would be the day...
column3: All my life I've always wanted to have one day for myself. Not waking up with a pile of work on every shelf. With no hems in need of pressing, and no sleeves in disarray. No wedding gown with a thousand stitches to crochet. And no debt to pay.
column4: gasps) Madame Carp!
column5: What do you think I'm running here? A cabaret?

column1: I would've said a debtor's prison.
column2: Keep laughing! You'll be working for me for another thirty-seven years!
column3: But I've already paid off more than half!
column4: But there's an interest, isn't there? Your parents should've thought of that before they borrowed so much.
column5: They did it to feed me!

column1: Their mistake!
column2: What would it be like to be...
column3: What would it be like to be... Free
column4: Free
column5: Free to try crazy things.

column1: Free from endless IOU's.
column2: Free to fly
column4: And marry whom I choose...
column5: I'm so sorry, my darling, but as you know, it is vital you marry King Dominick. It is the only way to take care of our people.

column1: I know, it's my duty.
column2: Oh, and look! Another engagement gift!
column3: You would think that I'm so lucky that I have so many things. I'm realizing that every present comes with strings.
column4: Though I know I have so little, my determination's strong. People will gather around the world to hear my song.
column5: Can I come along?

column1: Now I fear I'll never be...
column2: Soon I will forever be...
column4: I close my eyes and feel myself fly a thousand miles away...
column5: I could take flight but would it be right? My conscience tells me stay.

column1: I'll remain forever royal.
column2: I'll repay my parent's debt.
column3: Duty means doing the things your heart may well regret.
column4: But I'll never stop believing.
column5: She can never stop my schemes.

column1: There's more to living than gloves and gowns and threads and seams. In my dreams, I'll be free!
column2: Ok, what idiot put this in here?
column4: Let us review, shall we? We are stealing gold! Is this shiny?
column5: No.

column1: Valuable?
column2: No.
column4: No.
column5: Focus, Nick. That's what you need. That and a break. Shh!!!

column1: Why, hello.
column2: Master Preminger, you're back... here... early. Hope you had a nice journey.
column3: Here you are, sir. The last of the gold from the Royal Mine. There's nothing left.
column4: Yeah, 'cos it's all yours!
column5: Yes, it is, very much mine. Finally!

column1: I've been bowing, I've been scraping, I've been lying like a rug. And for ten long years I've had to pay my dues.
column2: Right, except for this one little problem, Boss.
column4: Right, and the queen decided to marry her off to the king of Dulcenia next week.
column5: What?! Making a decision without me? Who does she think she is?

column1: Uh, the queen?
column2: You simpering simpleton!
column3: Well, she is the queen! She's got a crown, a scepter, and sits in her great big fancy chair... and those...
column4: Silencio!
column5: No! I won't let go! This peasant's son won't turn and run because some reckless royal chose another beau! Ahh! It's... a... Temporary setback!

column1: So... get.. ready with the roses and stand by with the champagne. When you've got a brilliant plan you never lose. Yes before the chapter closes. I'll be as big as Charlemagne.
column2: Enjoy it now, sister, 'cos it ain't gonna be yours much longer.
column3: Oh, please, having delusions again, Midas?
column4: Let's just say the throne's gonna belong to my master, Preminger, and anything belonging to him ergo and ipso facto, belongs to me.
column5: Meows) You lose a tooth, Midas?

column1: My tooth? No, no, not my tooth! Ah you better hope you got 9 lives, Serafina! 'Cos you're gonna need 'em all!
column2: I am Ambassador Bismark, here by invitation of the queen. King Dominick, you are quite sure about this?
column4: Come in! Julian, perfect timing. I classified this as iron pyrite. Pretty, but not considered valuable. Commonly known as "fools gold".
column5: Well done, your highness.

column1: Your highness? Why the sudden formality? It's just me.
column2: The queen sent me. Apparently the ambassador has arrived with a gift for you.
column4: On behalf of King Dominick... I present this engagement gift to you.
column5: Oh! Thank you, ambassador! Princess Anneliese will be quite pleased.

column1: May I enquire, Your Excellency, if you've set a date for the wedding?
column2: Will a week from today do?
column3: Ah! Next week? A most wise and thoughtful decision, Your Majesty.
column4: Excellent. I will... er, send for King Dominick, so that he may meet his new bride.
column5: So happy. Free to do whatever they want. What do you think King Dominick will be like?

column1: Oh I'm sure he'll be... suitable.
column2: Oh, I know it's the right thing to marry him, but sometimes I wish... well...
column3: Apparently he's a lover of music. He plays 3 different instruments. The dulcimer, the trumpet, and the piano. Anneliese... you're going to need your cape.
column4: I am? Why?
column5: There's nothing like some fresh air and a change of scenery.

column1: I wish it were that simple. Come on, Serafina. Ah, it feels so good to be outside the castle walls. Nobody knows who I am. So, which one was your house?
column2: More of a room, really. We couldn't afford a house.
column4: I know. Third floor on the left. Did all my studies there.
column5: A perfect example of 'rosa centifolia'.

column1: My favorite! But, you knew that.
column2: Mmm, that smells delicous.
column4: Like a bird that flies in the morning light. Or a butterfly in the spring. When your spirit rides on the wings of hope, You'll find your wings.
column5: Let's go listen, Serafina.

column1: For you're always free to begin again. And you're always free to believe. When you find your place that your heart belongs-
column2: Caroling?
column3: Madame Carp! Wait, I earned that!
column4: And you owe me. Did you really think you could make a living as a singer? Get back to work, girl, or there'll be trouble.
column5: What a beautiful song.

column1: Thanks. My mom taught it... to... me.
column2: Whoa
column4: What's your name?
column5: You first.

column1: Please, call me Anneliese.
column2: Anneliese? You have the same name as the princess.
column4: Oh. I'm Erika, Your Highness. Aren't you supposed to be inside the castle?
column5: I'm savoring a first and last taste of freedom before getting married next week... to a total stranger.

column1: At least you're not an indentured servant.
column2: Indentured servant?
column3: If I'd like to have my breakfast hot, Madame Carp will make me pay. And I have to fetch the eggs myself and the barn's a mile away.
column4: Really?
column5: Really, but it's alright. I mean, I'm used to it. And you?

column1: Well...
column2: Well?
column3: If I want some eggs I ring the bell and the maid comes running in. And she serves them on a silver tray and she brings a cookie tin.
column4: I'm just like you
column5: You are?

column1: You're just like me. There's somewhere else we'd rather be. Somewhere that's ours, somewhere that dreams come true. Yes, I am a girl like you.
column2: So! You're a singer?
column3: No, I work at Madame Carp's penitentiary. Uh, I mean Dress Emporium.
column4: I love Madame Carp's Dresses!
column5: I made the one you're wearing.

column1: You made this? It's my favorite. The design looks so complicated!
column2: Oh, but it isn't, really...
column3: I wear the gown, without my crown and dance around my room.
column4: And imagine life without the strife of an unfamiliar groom.
column5: But I'd never let my Mother know. I wouldn't want to disappoint her.

column1: I completely understand.
column2: I'm just like you
column4: You're just like me
column5: Yes, I can see

column1: We take responsibility.
column2: We carry through.
column4: Do what we need to do. Yes, I am a girl like you
column5: I'm just like you

column1: I'm just like you
column2: You're just like me
column4: It's something anyone can see
column5: A heart that beats

column1: A heart that beats
column2: A voice that speaks the truth. Yes, I am a girl like you.
column3: It's amazing! Except for our hair.
column4: We could be twins!
column5: What about this birthmark?

column1: Hm, no, I guess not.
column2: Here, Your Highness.
column4: Serafina!
column5: Wolfie!

column1: Look who's a long way from the Palace!
column2: Don't get any ideas, Midas. I don't get these nails filed for nothing.
column4: Growls) I'm warning you, leave her alone!
column5: Heh! Or you'll do what? Spit a hairball at me?

column1: Quite a big bark you have there, Rover!
column2: Uh, it's uh, Wolfie. Not Rover.
column3: Well, thank you Wolfie, not Rover. My name's Serafina.
column4: Uh, I haven't seen you around here before.
column5: I don't think we run in the same circles, but... perhaps we can change that.

column1: There you are.
column2: Did I just hear your cat bark?
column3: He has a style all his own.
column4: I'm sorry, Your Highness, we should be getting back.
column5: One day you must sing for us at the Palace,

column1: Really?
column2: I'll send someone for you.
column4: Goodbye, Erika! I won't forget.
column5: Goodbye! Come on, Wolfie. Wolfie? Cat got your tongue? Come on, boy.

column1: I may be dainty, but I'm still a feline!
column2: We did it! Let's go.
column3: Come here, Nick. Our job is to capture the princess... not her cat!
column4: Right. What'd we get the cat for?
column5: Allow me to demonstrate, dimwit.

column1: Serafina? Serafina, where are you? Serafina, come here girl, come here kitty!
column2: Well! That certainly wasn't called for.
column4: No, I am not okay! My Mistress is inside with two hooligans, and I've got dirt... dirt on my bum! Who are you?
column5: Hervé.

column1: Nice to meet you, Hervé. I'm Serafina.
column2: I command you to unlock this door!
column4: mimicking) Yes, Your Highness! We're in charge here!
column5: Right. I knew that!

column1: I can't believe they won't let me in there. My princess needs me.
column2: I'm sure the boss will let her out.
column4: That boss!
column5: Signed, sealed, and delivered Master Preminger!

column1: Does she know I'm behind this?
column2: No idea.
column3: Good! Keep her here until the wedding to King Dominick is cancelled.
column4: Then we'll see who the princess marries!
column5: Oh, he is nasty! Just like his dog. Think you could get me up to the roof?

column1: I do not know. It is pretty high up.
column2: You can do this! Trust me, Hervé. Just count to three.
column4: Thank you, Hervé. A girl's got to do what a girl's got to do!
column5: Serafina?

column1: I am simply not going to look at myself.
column2: Anneliese. Anneliese, Darling? Are you here? Where could she be? She wasn't at breakfast.
column3: Is that something on her desk, Your Majesty?
column4: Oh, a letter to me. Gasps) It says she's run away, so she won't have to marry King Dominick!
column5: Well this is dreadful!

column1: We have to find her. She could be hurt!
column2: Well I'll send out search parties at once, Your Majesty. I'm sure she couldn't have gotten far.
column3: Preminger, what would I do without you?
column4: This is an outrage! The most grievous insult!
column5: I am sure we'll find her.

column1: I insist we cancel the wedding if the princess does not return by the end of the day!
column2: It doesn't add up. Why would she run away?
column3: Why don't you see for yourself.
column4: Lilac? Where did you find this?
column5: On the princess's desk.

column1: Perhaps I can help you look for her.
column2: Why don't you stick to your books, schoolboy. Wouldn't that be fun? Laughs)
column3: Lilac? She never scented her stationary with lilac. It was always rose.
column4: Welcome, sir. Are you looking for a gown for a special lady? I can assure you, you will find only the finest at Madame Carp's.
column5: If I may, I would like to speak to one of your seamstresses, Miss Erika.

column1: I don't believe it! The princess sent for me!
column2: Oh, actually-
column3: I'm going to sing at the castle... me!
column4: I came because-
column5: But, I'm not ready. I-I have to rehearse!

column1: If I could just...
column2: I better change my dress. Ho-ho, what am I talking about? I only have one dress! Wait, isn't that why you're here?
column3: I'm sorry, but no. The princess is missing and I need you to help me find her.
column4: Me? Well what can I do?
column5: Pretend to be princess Anneliese.

column1: Gasps) Are you out of your mind?
column2: Just listen. I suspect Preminger, the queen's adviser, has taken the princess off somewhere so the Royal Wedding will be cancelled.
column4: If you pretend to be the princess, just for a short while, I can trick Preminger into revealing where he's hiding her.
column5: Pretend to be royalty? I could get thrown in prison, or worse!

column1: As can I but...
column2: She's in real trouble, isn't she? A girl like me... Count me in.
column3: Would you look at the size of this place!
column4: The likeness is remarkable.
column5: Except for my hair.

column1: I've thought of that.
column2: Wolfie! Nice!
column4: Um, Julian, we're missing one teeny tiny detail. I don't know a thing about being a Princess.
column5: Leave that to me.

column1: I see now.
column2: Breathing gently, stepping lightly. Smile brightly, nod politely. Never show a thing you feel inside. Glide! To be a princess is to always look your best. To be a princess is to never get to rest.
column4: And... she has beautiful eyes your spirits rise when she walks in the room.
column5: I see.

column1: Doors close and the chemistry grows. She's like a rose that's forever in bloom. his voice breaks and he coughs) Do a plié and don't
column2: Ever ever ever fall
column4: And be there when people call
column5: Be prepared whatever royal life will bring. Do keep a grip and don't...

column1: Ever ever ever crack
column2: Take a dainty sip
column4: There's a time and place and way for everything. To be a princess is to never make your bed. To be a princess is to always use your head. Erika: Ahh!
column5: It is official, then. Due to the disappearance of the princess, the wedding to King Dominick is cancelled.

column1: Your Highness, wait! May I present, Princess Anneliese.
column2: Darling?
column4: Anneliese? Oh-ho, you're back! Where have you been?
column5: I am sorry. I should not have run away.

column1: Promise me you'll never do it again.
column2: I still think we should cancel the wedding.
column3: Yes, yes, but an agreement is an agreement. The wedding is back on! King Dominick is...is.. is due tomorrow!
column4: Wonderful.
column5: Uh, tomorrow?

column1: And then, only a few short days before the wedding. Has anyone seen my spectacles?
column2: If you'll excuse me, I must be off to see to the... ack!... arrangements. Ahh! Who let this mangey beast in here?
column4: It soon will be. laughs)
column5: What have you got there, boy? From a silver fir tree. What's Preminger doing in the Western Forest?

column1: Julian, wait! I want to hear all about how you found Anneliese!
column2: Ah... ah... of course, Your Majesty.
column3: Hey! I happen to know you've got a 5 of hearts.
column4: What do you mean you know?
column5: I saw it!

column1: You mean you cheated!
column2: Yeah. I mean, no!
column4: Yes, Your Highness?
column5: What is it?

column1: Hurry!
column2: Ghost!
column4: You're older, you get it!
column5: You're closer, you get it! It's got me!

column1: Help!
column2: No, please!
column4: Let me in... you idiots!
column5: Your Bossness, everything is fine. Fine, fine, fine, fine. Just fine! See you soon.

column1: How did she escape?
column2: Who?
column3: Who? The princess! You moron! Idiot!
column4: The princess is here. Sleeping! Aren't you sleeping, Princess?!
column5: High Pitched Voice) Yes. I'm sleeping.

column1: Now, boss, you don't want to wake her up, do you? She's a Royal... She's a Royal, all right,
column2: A royal pain in the behind!
column4: Slumber, you bonehead!
column5: Slumber, right! In normal voice): I knew that.

column1: Get out of that bed! I can figure out how the princess escaped you fools! But why didn't she tell the queen she'd been captured? Hmm, something's odd. I must solve this Princess puzzle if I'm to be King.
column2: King? Preminger?
column4: How can you be King?
column5: You're the tutor. You're supposed to have all the answers.

column1: Come here, Serafina.
column2: Who goes there?
column4: If you're the princess, I'm the king.
column5: But, I am the princess.

column1: Really? Then how come I just saw the princess eating dinner with the queen?
column2: What princess?
column3: Now move along before I lost my temper.
column4: You are speaking to Princess Anneliese! Let me through!
column5: I said move along! Now!

column1: We'll find help in here.
column2: What are you doing here?
column4: Not another word! You're coming with me!
column5: How dare you speak to her that way!

column1: How dare I? H-h-how dare I?! Just who do you think you are?
column2: Princess Anneliese!
column3: That's a hoot! You've got to change a lot more than your hair to look like the princess. Why me and the princess are close, personal friends.
column4: Oh really?
column5: Now, shut up and get back to work!

column1: I'm warning you, if you're going to treat your seamstresses this way, we'll take our royal business elsewhere.
column2: You're warning me? We'll see your attitude change by morning. You're not coming out until every dress is finished... Erika!
column4: Erika? That is you, isn't it?
column5: "Made exclusively by Madame Carp".

column1: If Wolfie can slip and in and out, I'm sure your pretty little Serafina can do it too.
column2: It's up to you now, Serafina. Take this to the Castle. When somebody reads the label, it'll lead them here.
column3: This is going to be a long night.
column4: I thought I was dreaming, but I'm not. Shh! Wolfie, we've gotta, you know, act like we live here! We can't give ourselves away. Be a Princess! Be a Princess! Come in.
column5: Did I hear a dog, Your Majesty? Should I call the Royal Dogcatcher?

column1: Ah, no, no. Dog? Everything is fine.
column2: Your breakfast, Your Highness.
column4: As always.
column5: Oh yes. Of course. Thank you. Look at all this food! Want some?

column1: Oh I-I couldn't, Your Highness!
column2: But there's enough to feed an army! Come on, take some.
column3: I, uh, thank you, um, m'lady. I'll draw your bath. Would you like bubbles, mineral salts, or lavender oil
column4: Everything!
column5: You're going to just tell her that you disguised yourself as a page? Are you sure that's wise, King Dominick?

column1: No, I'm not sure. But I have to be honest. I think she'll understand. I didn't want to marry a stranger any more than she did.
column2: Sighing) I may never come out.
column4: What's wrong, Wolfie? Are you sick? Something in your throat?
column5: Mehh-

column1: Wait a minute. Are you trying to meow?
column2: Mehh- Woof!
column3: Oh, fella... I can see it when you're feeling low, you can't hide that from me. You're no status quo calico so why keep trying to be? 'Cause you're more than that, you're a doggish cat. I wish you could see the you I see...
column4: Mehh-
column5: No. I say, if you bark celebrate it. Make your mark, serenade it. Noah's ark should've had a cat like you. And if what you are is a strange you. Doesn't mean you should change you. Only means you should change your point of view...

column1: Princess Anneliese?
column2: Hey, feline. You fetch just fine you. To thine ownself be true. Your bow wow's the cat's meow. It's how I know you're you.
column4: That's my boy!
column5: There, this one's finished! Uh, sort of...

column1: Please, Your Highness, you don't have to do this!
column2: I can't let you do it all by yourself.
column3: How am I going to do this? Everyone will know I'm a fake. They'll throw me in the dungeon in two seconds flat! Oh Julian, where are you? Why aren't you here?
column4: Your most beautiful, Highness.
column5: What's this stupid cat doing here?

column1: He belongs to me!
column2: Oh! He's yours, is he? Well, a thousand apologies, my lady. Such a canine... feline. What happened to the other one?
column4: I see. So rare... that you're apart. The queen has sent me to escort you to meet the king.
column5: Uhh... Thank you.

column1: I appreciate your understanding, Your majesty.
column2: Likewise, King Dominick. I apologize for my daughter's little delay in the wedding plans. But it's all sorted out now.
column4: Oh hello, Darling. Come, come. I want to introduce you to King Dominick. He has something he wants to tell you. Where are my spectacles?
column5: I'm honored.

column1: Uhh... The honor's mine, King Dominick.
column2: Please, just call me Dominick.
column3: Oh, call me Eri... I mean Anneliese. Princess Anneliese. That's my name.
column4: I hope his bark is bigger than his bite.
column5: He likes you.

column1: I'm sure you're wondering why I disguised myself as a page. I wanted to meet you without all this-this ceremony. To get to know the real you.
column2: Uh, the real me...
column3: King Dominick, would you do us the honor of playing the piano? I know you love music.
column4: You do?
column5: I will, if the princess agrees to sing with me.

column1: Sing with you. Uh, no, no, I couldn't.
column2: Something tells me you have a wonderful voice.
column4: Once a lass met a lad. "You're a gentle one" said she. In my heart I'd be glad if you loved me for me. You say your love is true and I hope that it will be...
column5: I'd be sure, if I knew that you loved me for me.

column1: Could I be the one you're seeking? Will I be the one you choose? Can you tell my heart is speaking? My eyes will give you clues
column2: What you see may be deceiving, truth lies underneath the skin...
column4: The heart that lies within
column5: I'll be yours. Together we shall always be as one, if you love me for me.

column1: Who can say where we'll go? I'll be yours. Together we shall always be as one) Who can promise what will be... But I'll stay by your side if you love me for me.
column2: If you love me for me.
column4: The prettiest sunset I've ever seen.
column5: There's something about you... You're honest ... no pretenses. I like that. Until tomorrow, Your Highness.

column1: "Honest"? "No pretenses"? Oh, Wolfie, Julian and the princess are still missing. And I think I'm falling in love with the king.
column2: Why, it's our missing little feline.
column3: But with an attitude, oh yes! I never liked cats. Hm. The princess's ring. How odd. Madame Carp's Dress Shop? Maybe the answer to our mystery.
column4: Thank you, Hervé.  gasps) My princess!
column5: Preminger, you found my ring! You good girl!

column1: Princess...
column2: Serafina, what's gotten into you?
column3: Come quickly, Princess. You can tell me everything on the way to the castle.
column4: But first let me... No, no. No time, Your Highness.
column5: Princess?

column1: What are we doing here?
column2: Taking a little side trip, Princess.
column4: Very clever planting a double to fool even me. But not quite clever enough. Checkmate! I win.
column5: Serafina!

column1: Nice to see you again, Your Highness.
column2: Watch your step.
column3: I don't understand, Preminger. Why would you do this?
column4: To be king.
column5: And how would you get to be king?

column1: Still underestimating me? Isn't that just like a royal.
column2: He was going to marry you
column4: Now, he's got a new bride in mind.
column5: Your mother is a very handsome woman. laughs evilly)

column1: Julian!
column2: Anneliese?!
column3: How sad they'll be when they discover you died in a tragic accident.
column4: They'll never give up looking for the princess!
column5: Oh I think they will. When I show them this! Evil laughter) Oh that's funny.

column1: No good.
column2: We have to stop him.
column3: Put a little muscle behind it!
column4: What's that?
column5: Move it!

column1: Everything seems to be in order. Thank you, Ambassador. The kingdoms will be officially joined after the wedding tomorrow. Are you ready, Darling?
column2: Ready...ha..ha, well...
column4: Whoa!
column5: Grab her! She's an imposter!

column1: Preminger, what are you doing?
column2: Get your hands off me!
column4: She's a fake! A common pauper!
column5: Are you telling me I don't know my own daughter?

column1: I only just discovered the truth myself, Your majesty. Have you not wondered why we haven't seen Julian lately? He's conspiring with this-this imposter! Together they took the princess and hid her in the Royal Mine so- so she could take her place, marry King Dominick and take over the kingdom!
column2: And what proof do you have of this ridiculous story?
column3: Once I discovered this treachery, I tried to rescue the princess but it was too late. They sabotaged the Mine, collapsing it. I'm afraid this is all my workers found in the rubble.
column4: No! It cannot be!
column5: Check her shoulder! There's no royal birthmark. I assure you.

column1: It's true...
column2: I don't believe it.
column4: Throw her in the dungeon!
column5: No, wait! I-I'm not the princess, but I never hurt her or anybody else!

column1: Unbelievable! It's an outrage!
column2: I-I just wanted to save the princess! From him!
column4: My daughter... My poor daughter...
column5: What do they take us for? Fools? Trying to marry you off to a mere pauper!?

column1: It doesn't make sense.
column2: I should say not. The sooner we leave, the happier I will be.
column3: Do a plié and never fall. Don't ever stray from protocol. All through the day there's just one way, you must behave. Do keep a grip and never crack, Stiff upper lip...Stiff upper lip... cries)
column4: Sobs)
column5: Ah! Just who I wanted to see.

column1: Preminger, what is it?
column2: So many problems. I'm here to help.
column3: You can't bring my daughter back.
column4: Too true. But I can provide the answer to saving your Kingdom. A little business venture of mine was very successful. You could say I "struck gold". I'm as wealthy as King Dominick.
column5: Are you Wolfie? Serafina's friend?

column1: I like to think so.
column2: She needs help, and so does the princess.

column1: Preminger played me for a fool. I'm sorry, my Darling Anneliese. When I think what might have happened...

column1: Princess Anneliese was right about the Mine. She discovered it was filled with geodes. Under her direction, the beautiful crystals created a new industry. The kingdom was saved.

column5: Love is like a melody, one that I will always treasure., courage is the key that opens every door...
